good evening this is the CBS Evening News Dan Rather reporting

the US surgeon general's latest report on smoking is out today this time zeroing in on smoking as a hazard in the workplace and this time Bob fall reports it isn't just the big tobacco Lobby that subset sum of the nation's big unions are doing a Not So Slow Burn about it too

it was this surgeon general's third broadside against the tobacco industry in four years of 17th by his office since 1964 this year's report concluded that for most American workers cigarette smoking poses a greater health risk than their workplace environment and the combination of exposure to hazardous materials like coal or cotton dust plus smoking that combination can be lethal the result may be a degree of disability that exceeds that which would be expected from either exposure alone

asbestos workers for example are already 10 times more likely to develop lung cancer than other workers but what the report found is that the likelihood of lung cancer is 50 times greater for asbestos workers who smoked and for those who don't 90 times greater for those who smoke a packer more day report also found that blue-collar males especially construction workers smoke roughly 40% more than white-collar employees they start smoking sooner and have more trouble quitting the Surgeon General says what's needed is a coordinated approach

cleaner workplace and less smoking but organized labor worries that employers will use smoking in its health risks as an excuse not to clean up hazardous factories and plants and employers across all Industries have always attempted to use a smoking argument to shirk their responsibilities to control workplace hazards and the tobacco industry suggested that coups report is more political and scientific are questioning is about what the motives are behind the report basically on that score the Surgeon General does not mince words
